Among the ninety-eight latent afflictions, in the desire realm, the views of self, extreme views, adherence to views, and adherence to precepts and vows, as well as the desire and pride eliminated during the path of seeing, are associated with two faculties, the faculty of joy and the faculty of equanimity.
Doubt and the hatred eliminated during the path of seeing are associated with two faculties, the faculty of sorrow and the faculty of equanimity.
Wrong views and the ignorance eliminated during the path of seeing are associated with three faculties, excluding the faculty of pleasure and the faculty of suffering.
The latent afflictions of craving eliminated during the path of cultivation are associated with three faculties, excluding the faculty of suffering and the faculty of sorrow.
Hatred is associated with three faculties, excluding the faculty of pleasure and the faculty of joy.
Pride is associated with two faculties, the faculty of joy and the faculty of equanimity.
The latent affliction of ignorance is associated with five faculties.
In the form realm, it is associated with three faculties, excluding the faculty of suffering and the faculty of sorrow.
In the formless realm, it is associated with one faculty, the faculty of equanimity. The seven chapters on faculties are concluded here.
How many of these three fetters are bound to the desire realm, how many are bound to the form realm, and how many are bound to the formless realm?
Answer:
All three have three aspects, either bound to the desire realm, bound to the form realm, or bound to the formless realm.
Greed, ill-will, delusion, and the desire-based impurities are bound to the desire realm;
the existence-based impurities are either bound to the form realm or bound to the formless realm;
the remaining three aspects are either bound to the desire realm, bound to the form realm, or bound to the formless realm.
Among the floods, the desire flood is bound to the desire realm;
the existence flood is either bound to the form realm or bound to the formless realm;
the remaining three aspects are either bound to the desire realm, bound to the form realm, or bound to the formless realm.
The yokes are also like this.
Among the clingings, the desire clinging is bound to the desire realm.
The self-identity clinging is either bound to the form realm or bound to the formless realm;
the remaining three aspects are either bound to the desire realm, bound to the form realm, or bound to the formless realm.
Among the fetters, the fetters of desire and ill-will are bound to the desire realm;
The remaining three are either bound to the desire realm, or to the form or formless realms.
The five hindrances, the fetter of ill-will, the fetter of envy, and the fetter of stinginess are bound to the desire realm;
The remaining three are either bound to the desire realm, or to the form or formless realms.
Among the lower part [of the aggregates], craving and ill-will are bound to the desire realm;
The remaining five views are either bound to the desire realm, or to the form or formless realms.
Among the loves of the body, the love of the nose and tongue are bound to the desire realm;
The love of the eye, ear, and body are either bound to the desire realm, or to the form realm;
The love of the mind is either bound to the desire realm, or to the form or formless realms.
Among the latent afflictions, the latent afflictions of craving and ill-will are bound to the desire realm;
The latent affliction of love of existence is either bound to the form realm, or to the formless realm;
The remaining three types may be either bound to the desire realm, or bound to the form or formless realms.
Among the fetters, the fetter of anger, the fetter of envy, and the fetter of stinginess are bound to the desire realm;
the remaining three types may be either bound to the desire realm, or bound to the form or formless realms.

Among the ninety-eight latent afflictive tendencies, thirty-six are bound to the desire realm, thirty-one are bound to the form realm, and thirty-one are bound to the formless realm. (End of the eighth section on binding.)
Are all the latent afflictive tendencies that are in the desire realm the latent afflictive tendencies of the desire realm?
Answer:
There are those that are the latent afflictive tendencies of the desire realm, but those latent afflictive tendencies are not in the desire realm.
What are those that are the latent afflictive tendencies of the desire realm, but those latent afflictive tendencies are not in the desire realm?
Answer:

The demon PÄpÄ«yÄn, who is bound by the latent afflictive tendencies, resides in the Brahma heaven. The TathÄgata says that he is also bound by the latent afflictive tendencies. Passing away from the form realm, he forms a between state in the desire realm. This is called those that are the latent afflictive tendencies of the desire realm, but those latent afflictive tendencies are not in the desire realm.
How are the defilements in the desire realm, but those defilements are not of the desire realm?
Answer:
The defilements that entangle one, upon passing away from the desire realm, form the intermediate existence of the form realm.

Also, the defilements that exist in the form and formless realms, manifest in the desire realm - this is called the defilements being in the desire realm, but those defilements are not of the desire realm.
How are the defilements of the desire realm, and those defilements also in the desire realm?
Answer:ğŸ”½The defilements that entangle one, upon passing away from the desire realm, form the intermediate existence and the birth existence of the desire realm.
Also, the defilements that exist in the desire realm, manifest in the desire realm - this is called the defilements being of the desire realm, and those defilements are also in the desire realm.
How are they neither the defilements of the desire realm, nor are those defilements in the desire realm?
Answer: The defilements that entangle one, upon passing away from the form realm, form the intermediate existence and the birth existence of the form realm.

Those who fall from the form realm and are reborn in the formless realm, those who fall from the formless realm and are reborn in the formless realm, and those who fall from the formless realm and are reborn in the form realm.

Also, all the fetters and afflictions that exist in the form and formless realms, abiding in the form realm and manifesting in the present, and all the fetters and afflictions that exist in the formless realm, abiding in the formless realm and manifesting in the present - these are called fetters and afflictions that are not of the desire realm, and those fetters and afflictions do not exist in the desire realm.
Are all the fetters and afflictions that are of the form realm those fetters and afflictions that exist in the form realm?
Answer:
There are fetters and afflictions that are of the form realm, but those fetters and afflictions do not exist in the form realm.
What are the fetters and afflictions that are of the form realm, but those fetters and afflictions do not exist in the form realm?
Answer:ğŸ”½Being entangled by the fetters and afflictions, one falls from the desire realm and forms the intermediate existence of the form realm.

Also, those fetters and afflictions that are of the form realm, abiding in the desire realm and manifesting in the present - these are called the fetters and afflictions of the form realm, but those fetters and afflictions do not exist in the form realm.
How are there afflictions in the form realm that are not form realm afflictions?
Answer:

The demon PÄpÄ«yÄn, bound by afflictions, resides in the Brahma heaven. The TathÄgata's words are also bound by afflictions. Passing away from the form realm, he forms a middle existence in the desire realm.
Also, all afflictions in the formless realm manifest in the form realm. These are called afflictions in the form realm that are not form realm afflictions.
How are there form realm afflictions that are also in the form realm?
Answer:
Bound by afflictions, passing away from the form realm, he forms a middle existence and birth existence in the form realm.
Also, all afflictions that are of the form realm manifest in the form realm. These are called form realm afflictions that are also in the form realm.
How are there afflictions that are not of the form realm and are also not in the form realm?
Answer:
The fetters and defilements that entangle one, from falling from the desire realm to forming the intermediate existence and subsequent existence of the desire realm.

From falling from the desire realm to being born in the formless realm, from falling from the formless realm to being born in the formless realm, and from falling from the formless realm to being born in the desire realm.
Also, the fetters and defilements that exist in the formless realm, abiding in the desire realm and manifesting in the present.

Also, the fetters and defilements that exist in the formless realm, abiding in the formless realm and manifesting in the present. These are called the fetters and defilements that are not of the form realm, and those fetters and defilements also do not exist in the form realm.
The same applies to the negation.
Are all the fetters and defilements that are of the formless realm, those fetters and defilements in the formless realm?
Answer:
Yes, all the fetters and defilements that are in the formless realm, those fetters and defilements are of the formless realm.
Are there any fetters and defilements that are of the formless realm, but those fetters and defilements are not in the formless realm?
Answer:
Yes, all the fetters and defilements that are of the formless realm, abiding in the desire and form realms and manifesting in the present.
Are all the fetters and latent tendencies not of the formless realm, and are those fetters and latent tendencies also not in the formless realm?
Answer:
It is so, all the fetters and latent tendencies are not of the formless realm, and those fetters and latent tendencies are also not in the formless realm.
Are there any fetters and latent tendencies not in the formless realm, and are those fetters and latent tendencies not not of the formless realm?
Answer:
There are, all the fetters and latent tendencies that are of the formless realm, abiding in the desire realm and form realm, manifesting in the formless realm (Chapter 9 ends here).
For the World-Honored One's disciples who have accomplished the view of the truths, if form has not yet been exhausted, are they bound by form?
Answer:
It is so.
If they are bound by form, has form not yet been exhausted?
Answer:
It is so.
If feeling has not yet been exhausted, are they bound by feeling?
Answer:
It is so, if feeling has not yet been exhausted, they are bound by feeling.
Are there any who are bound by feeling, but feeling has not yet been exhausted?
Answer:

Yes, for one who is a once-returner or a family-to-family, when the fetters to be eliminated by the superior and middling contemplations of the desire realm are exhausted, the associated feelings are bound by the lower fetters.
The same applies to perceptions, mental formations, and consciousness.
If the World-Honored One's disciples who have attained insight have already exhausted form, are they liberated from form?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
If form is unattached, is it exhausted?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
If feelings have already been exhausted, are they unattached?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.ğŸ”½If feelings are unattached, are they exhausted?
Are there feelings that are exhausted but not unattached?
Answer:

Yes, for one who is a once-returner or a family-to-family, when the fetters to be eliminated by the superior and middling contemplations of the desire realm are exhausted, the associated feelings are bound by the lower fetters.
The same applies to perceptions, mental formations, and consciousness.
The five people are: one who firmly believes, one who firmly practices, one who is liberated by faith, one who attains by insight, and one who is liberated by the body.
How many of the three bonds does a person who firmly believes possess, and how many does he not possess?
Answer:
If the knowledge of the unknown suffering has not yet arisen, he possesses all [three bonds].
If the knowledge of the unknown suffering has arisen, he possesses two [bonds] and does not possess one [bond].
If desire and hatred have not yet been eliminated, he possesses all [three bonds].
If desire has already been eliminated, he does not possess any [of the three bonds].
In the case of the contaminated [aggregates], if desire has not yet been eliminated, he possesses all [three bonds];
if desire has already been eliminated, he possesses two [bonds] and does not possess one [bond].
In the case of the floods, if desire has not yet been eliminated, he possesses all [three bonds];
if desire has already been eliminated, he possesses three [bonds] and does not possess one [bond].
The same applies to the yokes and clingings.
In the case of the bonds, if desire has not yet been eliminated, he possesses all [three bonds];
if desire has already been eliminated, he possesses two [bonds] and does not possess two [bonds].
Among the five hindrances, if desire and love have not yet been exhausted and the knowledge of the Dharma of the path has not yet arisen, all are accomplished.
If desire and love have not yet been exhausted and the knowledge of the Dharma of the path has arisen, four are accomplished and one is not accomplished.
If desire and love have already been exhausted, none are accomplished.
Among the seven bonds, if desire and love have not yet been exhausted, all are accomplished.
If desire and love have already been exhausted, two are accomplished and three are not accomplished.
Among the five lower bonds, if desire and love have not yet been exhausted and the knowledge of suffering and the unknown has not yet arisen, all are accomplished.

If desire and love have not yet been exhausted and the knowledge of suffering and the unknown has arisen, four are accomplished and one is not accomplished.ğŸ”½If desire and love have already been exhausted and the knowledge of suffering and the unknown has not yet arisen, three are accomplished and two are not accomplished.
If desire and love have already been exhausted and the knowledge of suffering and the unknown has arisen, two are accomplished and three are not accomplished.
Among the five views, if the knowledge of suffering and the unknown has not yet arisen, all are accomplished.
When the knowledge of the unknown suffering arises, three are accomplished, and two are not accomplished.
Among the body loves, if the desire love is not yet exhausted, all are accomplished.
If the desire love is already exhausted, but the Brahma heaven love is not yet exhausted, four are accomplished, and two are not accomplished.
If the Brahma heaven love is exhausted, one is accomplished, and five are not accomplished.
Among the fetters, if the desire love is not yet exhausted, all are accomplished.
If the desire love is already exhausted, five are accomplished, and two are not accomplished.
Among the bonds, if the desire love is not yet exhausted, all are accomplished.
If the desire love is already exhausted, six are accomplished, and three are not accomplished.
Among the ninety-eight latent afflictions, if the desire love is not yet exhausted and the knowledge of the law of suffering has not yet arisen, all are accomplished.

If the knowledge of the law of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of the unknown suffering has not yet arisen, those to be eliminated by the truth of suffering in the desire realm are not accomplished, while the rest are accomplished.

When the knowledge of the unsatisfactoriness of the formless realm arises and the knowledge of the law of the formless realm has not yet arisen, one does not accomplish the abandonment of the truth of unsatisfactoriness in the three realms, but accomplishes the rest.ğŸ”½When the knowledge of the law of the formless realm arises and the knowledge of the origin of the formless realm has not yet arisen, one does not accomplish the abandonment of the truth of unsatisfactoriness in the three realms, but accomplishes the rest.

When the knowledge of the origin of the formless realm arises and the knowledge of the cessation of the formless realm has not yet arisen, one does not accomplish the abandonment of the truth of unsatisfactoriness and the truth of origin in the three realms, but accomplishes the rest.

When the knowledge of the cessation of the formless realm arises and the knowledge of the path of the formless realm has not yet arisen, one does not accomplish the abandonment of the truth of unsatisfactoriness, the truth of origin, and the truth of cessation in the three realms, but accomplishes the rest.ğŸ”½When the knowledge of the path of the formless realm arises, one does not accomplish the abandonment of the truth of unsatisfactoriness, the truth of origin, and the truth of cessation in the three realms, but accomplishes the rest.

When desire love has already ended and form love has not yet ended, and the knowledge of suffering and ignorance has not yet arisen, all in the desire realm are not accomplished, and the rest are accomplished.ğŸ”½When the knowledge of suffering and ignorance has arisen, and the knowledge of the accumulation and ignorance has not yet arisen, all in the desire realm are not accomplished, and the rest of the suffering truth in the form and formless realms are accomplished.

When the knowledge of the accumulation and ignorance has arisen, and the knowledge of the end and ignorance has not yet arisen, all in the desire realm are not accomplished, and the rest of the suffering and accumulation truths in the form and formless realms are accomplished.

When the knowledge of the end and ignorance has arisen, all in the desire realm are not accomplished, and the rest of the suffering, accumulation, and end truths in the form and formless realms are accomplished.

When form love has already ended, and formless love has not yet ended, and the knowledge of suffering and ignorance has not yet arisen, all in the desire and form realms are not accomplished, and the rest are accomplished.

When the knowledge of the suffering of the upper realms has arisen but the knowledge of the suffering of the lower realms has not yet arisen, one does not yet accomplish all [the roots of virtue] of the desire and form realms, but one accomplishes the remaining [roots of virtue] of the formless realm.ğŸ”½When the knowledge of the suffering of the lower realms has arisen but the knowledge of the suffering of the upper realms has not yet arisen, one does not yet accomplish all [the roots of virtue] of the desire and form realms, but one accomplishes the remaining [roots of virtue] of the formless realm.

When the knowledge of the suffering of the upper realms has arisen, one does not yet accomplish all [the roots of virtue] of the desire and form realms, but one accomplishes the remaining [roots of virtue] of the formless realm.
The same applies to those of firm nature.
For those liberated by faith, how many of these three bonds are accomplished and how many are not accomplished?
The answer is:
None are accomplished.
If desire and hatred have not yet been eliminated, all are accomplished;
if desire has already been eliminated, none are accomplished.
In the case of those with outflows, if desire has not yet been eliminated, all are accomplished;
If desire has already ended, two are accomplished and one is not accomplished.
In terms of the floods, if desire has not yet ended, three are accomplished and one is not accomplished;
if desire has already ended, two are accomplished and two are not accomplished.
The yokes are also like this.
In terms of the clingings, if desire has not yet ended, two are accomplished and two are not accomplished;
if desire has already ended, one is accomplished and three are not accomplished.
In terms of the bonds, if desire has not yet ended, two are accomplished and two are not accomplished;
if desire has already ended, all are not accomplished.
In terms of the hindrances, if desire has not yet ended, four are accomplished and one is not accomplished;
if desire has already ended, all are not accomplished.
In terms of the bonds, if desire has not yet ended, all are accomplished;ğŸ”½if desire has already ended, two are accomplished and three are not accomplished.
In terms of the lower bonds, if desire has not yet ended, two are accomplished and three are not accomplished;
When desire for sensual pleasure is exhausted, all are not accomplished.
Views are not accomplished.
In the love for the body, when desire for sensual pleasure is not yet exhausted, all are accomplished;
when desire for sensual pleasure is already exhausted but love for the Brahma Heaven is not yet exhausted, four are accomplished and two are not accomplished;
when love for the Brahma Heaven is exhausted, one is accomplished and five are not accomplished.
Among the fetters, when desire for sensual pleasure is not yet exhausted, five are accomplished and two are not accomplished;
when desire for sensual pleasure is already exhausted, three are accomplished and four are not accomplished.
Among the bonds, when desire for sensual pleasure is not yet exhausted, six are accomplished and three are not accomplished;
when desire for sensual pleasure is already exhausted, three are accomplished and six are not accomplished.
Among the ninety-eight latent afflictions, when desire for sensual pleasure is not yet exhausted, ten are accomplished and eighty-eight are not accomplished;
when desire for sensual pleasure is already exhausted but desire for form is not yet exhausted, six are accomplished and ninety-two are not accomplished;
When desire for form is already exhausted but desire for the formless is not yet exhausted, three are accomplished, and ninety-five are not accomplished.
The same is true for one who has attained the view of the noble truths.
For one who has attained bodily realization, how many of these three bonds are accomplished and how many are not accomplished?
Answer:
None are accomplished.
Greed, ill-will, and delusion are not accomplished.
Among the contaminated [aggregates], two are accomplished and one is not accomplished.
Among the floods, two are accomplished and two are not accomplished.
The same is true for the yokes.
Among the clingings, one is accomplished and three are not accomplished.
The bonds are not accomplished.
The hindrances are not accomplished.
Among the bonds, two are accomplished and three are not accomplished.
The lower bonds are not accomplished.
The views are not accomplished.
Among the bodily desires, one is accomplished and five are not accomplished.ğŸ”½Among the latent afflictions, three are accomplished and four are not accomplished.
Among the bonds, three are accomplished and six are not accomplished.
Among the ninety-eight kinds of defilements, three are accomplished, and ninety-five are not accomplished. Twelve sections are completed.
As for the view of the body, how many conditions does it have as a condition for the view of the body?
Answer:
Either four, three, two, or one.
Who has four?
Answer:

As the view of the body arises in succession to the view of the body, the previous and subsequent [views] are the cause, immediate antecedent condition, condition, and dominant condition. These are called four.
Who has three?
Answer:

As the view of the body arises in succession to the view of the body, without contemplating the previous and subsequent [views], there is the cause, immediate antecedent condition, and dominant condition, but no condition.

As the view of the body arises in succession to various minds, the view of the body arises. Contemplating the previous and subsequent [views], there is the cause, condition, and dominant condition, but no immediate antecedent condition. These are called three.
Who has two?
Answer:

Just as the view of a real self gives rise to various minds in succession, the view of a real self does not contemplate the previously arisen and subsequently arisen [minds], [but] is the cause and dominant condition of them. These are called two.
Who is one?
The answer is:
The subsequently arisen and the previously arisen, if with conditions, are the condition and dominant condition;
if without conditions, they are one dominant condition.
The future, past, and present, if with conditions, are the condition and dominant condition;
if without conditions, they are one dominant condition.
The future and present, past, if with conditions, are the condition and dominant condition;
if without conditions, they are one dominant condition.
The desire realm-bound and form realm-bound [minds] are one dominant condition.
The form realm-bound and desire realm-bound [minds], if with succession, are the succession and dominant condition;
if without succession, they are one dominant condition.ğŸ”½The desire realm-bound and formless realm-bound [minds] are one dominant condition.
The formless realm-bound and desire realm-bound [minds], if with succession, are the succession and dominant condition;
Not with the next, one is dominant.
The form realm and formless realm, one is dominant.
The formless realm and form realm, if with the next, it is the next and dominant;
not with the next, one is dominant.
Like the view of a real self, the view of a real self is like this, not all-pervading, not all-pervading, not all-pervading, all-pervading.
How many conditions are there for the view of a real self and the grasping of precepts and rituals?
Answer:
Either four, three, two, or one.
Who has four?
Answer:

Like the view of a real self, immediately giving rise to the grasping of precepts and rituals, that which is contemplated arises before and after, as cause, next, condition, and dominant, these are called four.
Who has three?
Answer:

Like the view of a real self, immediately giving rise to the grasping of precepts and rituals, that which is not contemplated arises before and after, as cause, next, and dominant, without conditions.
